formatted_address: 407 Northshore Drive, #01-08 to 18, Northshore Plaza, I, Singapore 820407
name: Giant Supermarket - Northshore Plaza I

reviews.text: It’s not an extremely large outlet from what you see on the outside, rather crammed actually when you are inside. That said, you will still be able to find the standard items for groceries on a daily basis - fresh poultry, fish, fruits, canned items, snacks and drinks. It’s well-stocked mostly with decent variety. Nothing like a Fairprice extra or finest they are not meant to be competing at that scale for this outlet at least anyways. Sometimes they do make use of the large open air atrium just outside for additional space to conduct larger sales for specific themes (e.g. CNY). Checkout is on a self-serve basis mainly if you are looking for a quicker and more efficient option. It’s a convenient location to grab groceries on overall, especially for residents in the area but don’t expect a super extensive range of goods.

This is by far the worst store in the Northshore area. The local Indian grocery store is so much better than this giant. The staff are poorly trained, and the management seems to lack any understanding of how to run a business. Every time I visit in the morning, I end up stuck in long queues. It's extremely frustrating."
Good offers n discounts to look out for and prices are kept reasonable. Well-patronised. Small area but packed with good variety of items.

Worst store in Northshore...just now to buy Panadol for back pain...which take 10 mis to find the key to open the box ..also was 24 Hours business...Main Exit door not open..have to go bigger rount to exit....is a big joke of this poor management store .

Not sure is it affected by CNY festive. Some of the items cannot be found , example enoki mushroom, dried orange skin, celery, fried beacurd skin.

Self payment kiosk have 4 units. Manual Cashier have 3 units.

Side note : CDC voucher is not accepted here.

vicinity: 407 Northshore Drive, #01-08 to 18, Northshore Plaza, I
